DICE Firmware Compiled on 8 Oct 2009

Application Building Blocks

Detailed Description

A number of application building blocks have been provided in the Firmware.

These building blocks are at the application layer and can be easily incorporated into the application.


Modules

 myApp Application entry point
 The general steps for creating your Application are:.
 myMode Configure Audio Interfaces and Streaming Modes
 A Mode is a configuration of DICE audio interfaces, routings, and clock rates.
 DICE Abstraction Layer (DAL)
 Exposes an Audio configuration API for router, clock and stream management, etc.
 Function Control Protocol (FCP)
 AV/C Handling
 Interfaces the AVC layer to the FCP layer and provides an interface for subunits to use.
 mLAN Support
 OGT (previously known as mLAN) support will be provided in Firmware updates.
 DiceDriver Support
 This module provides an interface for the device to work with the Host DICE Driver.
 AvcDriver Support
 This modules provides an interface for the device to work with the AV/C Class Compliant Driver.
 Firmware Load over 1394
